intro: Eriosema rogersii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has a bushy growth habit with compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Eriosema rogersii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and nocturnal blooming habit.
